g3701.definition: [ὀπτασία] from a presumed derivative of {{g3700}}; visuality, i.e. (concretely) an apparition

g3702.definition: [ὀπτός] from an obsolete verb akin to ἕπσω (to "steep"); cooked, i.e. roasted

g3703.definition: [ὀπώρα] apparently from the base of {{g3796}} and {{g5610}}; properly, even-tide of the (summer) season (dog-days), i.e. (by implication) ripe fruit

g3704.definition: [ὅπως] from {{g3739}} and {{g4459}}; what(-ever) how, i.e. in the manner that (as adverb or conjunction of coincidence, intentional or actual)

g3705.definition: [ὅραμα] from {{g3708}}; something gazed at, i.e. a spectacle (especially supernatural)

g3706.definition: [ὅρασις] from {{g3708}}; the act of gazing, i.e. (externally) an aspect or (internally) an inspired appearance

g3707.definition: [ὁρατός] from {{g3708}}; gazed at, i.e. (by implication) capable of being seen

g3708.definition: [ὁράω] properly, to stare at (compare {{g3700}}), i.e. (by implication) to discern clearly (physically or mentally); by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear

g3709.definition: [ὀργή] from {{g3713}}; properly, desire (as a reaching forth or excitement of the mind), i.e. (by analogy), violent passion (ire, or (justifiable) abhorrence); by implication punishment

g3710.definition: [ὀργίζω] from {{g3709}}; to provoke or enrage, i.e. (passively) become exasperated

g3712.definition: [ὀργυιά] from {{g3713}}; a stretch of the arms, i.e. a fathom

g3713.definition: [ὀρέγομαι] middle voice of apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary (compare {{g3735}}); to stretch oneself, i.e. reach out after (long for)

g3714.definition: [ὀρεινός] from {{g3735}}; mountainous, i.e. (feminine by implication, of {{g5561}}) the Highlands (of Judæa)

g3715.definition: [ὄρεξις] from {{g3713}}; excitement of the mind, i.e. longing after

g3716.definition: [ὀρθοποδέω] from a compound of {{g3717}} and {{g4228}}; to be straight-footed, i.e. (figuratively) to go directly forward

g3717.definition: [ὀρθός] probably from the base of {{g3735}}; right (as rising), i.e. (perpendicularly) erect (figuratively, honest), or (horizontally) level or direct

g3718.definition: [ὀρθοτομέω] from a compound of {{g3717}} and the base of {{g5114}}, to make a straight cut, i.e. (figuratively) to dissect (expound) correctly (the divine message)

g3719.definition: [ὀρθρίζω] from {{g3722}}; to use the dawn, i.e. (by implication) to repair betimes

g3720.definition: [ὀρθρινός] from {{g3722}}; relating to the dawn, i.e. matutinal (as an epithet of Venus, especially brilliant in the early day)

g3721.definition: [ὄρθριος] from {{g3722}}; in the dawn, i.e. up at day-break

g3722.definition: [ὄρθρος] from the same as {{g3735}}; dawn (as sun-rise, rising of light); by extension, morn

g3723.definition: [ὀρθῶς] adverb from {{g3717}}; in a straight manner, i.e. (figuratively) correctly (also morally)

g3724.definition: [ὁρίζω] from {{g3725}}; to mark out or bound ("horizon"), i.e. (figuratively) to appoint, decree, specify

g3725.definition: [ὅριον] neuter of a derivative of an apparently primary ὅρος (a bound or limit); a boundary-line, i.e. (by implication) a frontier (region)

g3726.definition: [ὁρκίζω] from {{g3727}}; to put on oath, i.e. make swear; by analogy, to solemnly enjoin

g3727.definition: [ὅρκος] from ἕρκος (a fence; perhaps akin to {{g3725}}); a limit, i.e. (sacred) restraint (specially, an oath)

g3728.definition: [ὁρκωμοσία] from a compound of {{g3727}} and a derivative of {{g3660}}; asseveration on oath

g3729.definition: [ὁρμάω] from {{g3730}}; to start, spur or urge on, i.e. (reflexively) to dash or plunge

g3730.definition: [ὁρμή] of uncertain affinity; a violent impulse, i.e. onset

g3732.definition: [ὄρνεον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g3733}}; a birdling

g3733.definition: [ὄρνις] probably from a prolonged form of the base of {{g3735}}; a bird (as rising in the air), i.e. (specially), a hen (or female domestic fowl)

g3734.definition: [ὁροθεσία] from a compound of the base of {{g3725}} and a derivative of {{g5087}}; a limit-placing, i.e. (concretely) boundary-line

g3735.definition: [ὄρος] probably from an obsolete ὄρω (to rise or "rear"; perhaps akin to {{g142}}; compare {{g3733}}); a mountain (as lifting itself above the plain)

g3736.definition: [ὀρύσσω] apparently a primary verb; to "burrow" in the ground, i.e. dig

g3737.definition: [ὀρφανός] of uncertain affinity; bereaved ("orphan"), i.e. parentless

g3738.definition: [ὀρχέομαι] middle voice from ὄρχος (a row or ring); to dance (from the ranklike or regular motion)

g3739.definition: [ὅς] , including feminine      ἥ, and neuter      ὅprobably a primary word (or perhaps a form of the article {{g3588}}); the relatively (sometimes demonstrative) pronoun, who, which, what, that See also {{g3757}}.

g3740.definition: [ὁσάκις] multiple adverb from {{g3739}}; how (i.e. with {{g302}}, so) many times as

g3741.definition: [ὅσιος] of uncertain affinity; properly, right (by intrinsic or divine character; thus distinguished from 1342, which refers rather to human statutes and relations; from {{g2413}}, which denotes formal consecration; and from {{g40}}, which relates to purity from defilement), i.e. hallowed (pious, sacred, sure) 342

g3745.definition: [ὅσος] by reduplication from {{g3739}}; as (much, great, long, etc.) as

g3747.definition: [ὀστέον] , or contracted      ὀστοῦνof uncertain affinity; a bone

g3748.definition: [ὅστις] , including the feminine      ἥτις, and the neuter      ὅτιfrom {{g3739}} and {{g5100}}; which some, i.e. any that; also (definite) which same Compare {{g3754}}.

g3749.definition: [ὀστράκινος] from ὄστρακον ("oyster") (a tile, i.e. terra cotta); earthen-ware, i.e. clayey; by implication, frail

g3750.definition: [ὄσφρησις] from a derivative of {{g3605}}; smell (the sense)

g3751.definition: [ὀσφῦς] of uncertain affinity; the loin (externally), i.e. the hip; internally (by extension) procreative power

g3752.definition: [ὅταν] from {{g3753}} and {{g302}}; whenever (implying hypothesis or more or less uncertainty); also causatively (conjunctionally) inasmuch as

g3753.definition: [ὅτε] from {{g3739}} and {{g5037}}; at which (thing) too, i.e. when

g3754.definition: [ὅτι] neuter of {{g3748}} as conjunction; demonstrative, that (sometimes redundant); causative, because

g3755.definition: [ὅτου] for the genitive case of {{g3748}} (as adverb); during which same time, i.e. whilst

g3756.definition: [οὐ] , also (before a vowel)      οὐκ, and (before an aspirate)      οὐχa primary word; the absolute negative (compare {{g3361}}) adverb; no or not See also {{g3364}}, {{g3372}}.

g3757.definition: [οὗ] genitive case of {{g3739}} as adverb; at which place, i.e. where

g3760.definition: [οὐδαμῶς] adverb from (the feminine) of {{g3762}}; by no means

g3761.definition: [οὐδέ] from {{g3756}} and {{g1161}}; not however, i.e. neither, nor, not even

g3762.definition: [οὐδείς] , including feminine      οὐδεμία, and neuter      οὐδένfrom {{g3761}} and {{g1520}}; not even one (man, woman or thing), i.e. none, nobody, nothing

g3763.definition: [οὐδέποτε] from {{g3761}} and {{g4218}}; not even at any time, i.e. never at all

g3765.definition: [οὐκέτι] , also (separately)       οὐκ ἔτιfrom {{g3756}} and {{g2089}}; not yet, no longer

g3766.definition: [οὐκοῦν] from {{g3756}} and {{g3767}}; is it not therefore that, i.e. (affirmatively) hence or so

g3767.definition: [οὖν] apparently a primary word; (adverbially) certainly, or (conjunctionally) accordingly

g3769.definition: [οὐρά] apparently a primary word; a tail

g3770.definition: [οὐράνιος] from {{g3772}}; celestial, i.e. belonging to or coming from the sky

g3771.definition: [οὐρανόθεν] from {{g3772}} and the enclitic of source; from the sky

g3772.definition: [οὐρανός] perhaps from the same as {{g3735}} (through the idea of elevation); the sky; by extension, heaven (as the abode of God); by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel (Christianity)

g3773.definition: [Οὐρβανός] of Latin origin; Urbanus (of the city, "urbane"), a Christian

g3774.definition: [Οὐρίας] of Hebrew origin ({{h223}}); Urias (i.e. Urijah), a Hittite

g3775.definition: [οὖς] apparently a primary word; the ear (physically or mentally)

g3776.definition: [οὐσία] from the feminine of {{g5607}}; substance, i.e. property (possessions)

g3777.definition: [οὔτε] from {{g3756}} and {{g5037}}; not too, i.e. neither or nor; by analogy, not even

g3778.definition: [οὗτος] , including nominative masculine plural      οὗτοι, nominative feminine singular      αὕτη, and nominative feminine plural      αὕταιfrom the article {{g3588}} and {{g846}}; the he (she or it), i.e. this or that (often with article repeated)

g3779.definition: [οὕτω] , or (before a vowel      οὕτωςadverb from {{g3778}}; in this way (referring to what precedes or follows)

g3781.definition: [ὀφειλέτης] from {{g3784}}; an ower, i.e. person indebted; figuratively, a delinquent; morally, a transgressor (against God)

g3782.definition: [ὀφειλή] from {{g3784}}; indebtedness, i.e. (concretely) a sum owed; figuratively, obligation, i.e. (conjugal) duty

g3783.definition: [ὀφείλημα] from (the alternate of) {{g3784}}; something owed, i.e. (figuratively) a due; morally, a fault

g3784.definition: [ὀφείλω] , or (in certain tenses), its prolonged form      ὀφειλέωprobably from the base of {{g3786}} (through the idea of accruing); to owe (pecuniarily); figuratively, to be under obligation (ought, must, should); morally, to fail in duty See also {{g3785}}.

g3785.definition: [ὄφελον] first person singular of a past tense of {{g3784}}; I ought (wish), i.e. (interjection) oh that!

g3786.definition: [ὄφελος] from ὀφέλλω (to heap up, i.e. accumulate or benefit); gain

g3787.definition: [ὀφθαλμοδουλεία] from {{g3788}} and {{g1397}}; sight-labor, i.e. that needs watching (remissness)

g3788.definition: [ὀφθαλμός] from {{g3700}}; the eye (literally or figuratively); by implication, vision; figuratively, envy (from the jealous side-glance)

g3789.definition: [ὄφις] probably from {{g3700}} (through the idea of sharpness of vision); a snake, figuratively, (as a type of sly cunning) an artful malicious person, especially Satan

g3790.definition: [ὀφρῦς] perhaps from {{g3700}} (through the idea of the shading or proximity to the organ of vision); the eye-"brow" or forehead, i.e. (figuratively) the brink of a precipice

g3791.definition: [ὀχλέω] from {{g3793}}; to mob, i.e. (by implication) to harass

g3792.definition: [ὀχλοποιέω] from {{g3793}} and {{g4160}}; to make a crowd, i.e. raise a public disturbance

g3793.definition: [ὄχλος] from a derivative of {{g2192}} (meaning a vehicle); a throng (as borne along); by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot

g3794.definition: [ὀχύρωμα] from a remote derivative of {{g2192}} (meaning to fortify, through the idea of holding safely); a castle (figuratively, argument)

g3795.definition: [ὀψάριον] neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of {{g3702}}; a relish to other food (as if cooked sauce), i.e. (specially), fish (presumably salted and dried as a condiment)

g3796.definition: [ὀψέ] from the same as {{g3694}} (through the idea of backwardness); (adverbially) late in the day; by extension, after the close of the day

g3798.definition: [ὄψιος] from {{g3796}}; late; feminine (as noun) afternoon (early eve) or nightfall (later eve)

g3799.definition: [ὄψις] from {{g3700}}; properly, sight (the act), i.e. (by implication) the visage, an external show

g3800.definition: [ὀψώνιον] neuter of a presumed derivative of the same as {{g3795}}; rations for a soldier, i.e. (by extension) his stipend or pay
